short_summary: Establish regional standards for intra-building wired networks through an open competitive procurement process.
description: Shared Services Canada is seeking ITQ respondents who have suitable experience and industry partnerships to participate in the Bid Solicitation Phase. The ITQ is intended to establish regional standards for intra-building wired networks and will be open to competitive bids. Respondents must resubmit their bids in P2P.
full_summary:
**Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) for the Procurement Process for Regional In-Building Wired Local Networks**

The Network and Security Services Branch of Shared Services Canada (SSC) invites interested suppliers to participate in the Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) for the procurement process for regional in-building wired local networks. The ITQ, which is being issued by SSC, aims to pre-qualify respondents who have suitable experience and industry partnerships to participate in the bid solicitation phase.

**Background Information**

SSC’s networks and security services branch is responsible for the planning, design, and operations of the Government of Canada (GC) IT network infrastructure, as well as the management of cyber and IT security services that protects GC data and technology assets. While the GC has adopted a wireless-first strategy for end-users, wired networks remain critical for both power users and wireless backhaul. Today, SSC’s wired intra-building networks are composed of various Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) platforms with little geographical standardization, leading to challenges in administration, training, and support for these local networks.

**Procurement Process**

SSC seeks to establish regional standards for intra-building wired networks on a regional basis through an open competitive procurement process. This ITQ is intended to pre-qualify respondents who have suitable experience and industry partnerships to participate in the bid solicitation phase. The submission deadline for ITQ BPM019831 has been extended to November 17, 2023 @ 3:00 PM Eastern Standard Time. Respondents must resubmit their bid in P2P.

**Key Contract Details**

* **Contracting Entity:** Shared Services Canada
* **End User Entities:** Shared Services Canada
* **Notice Date:** November 8, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** November 17, 2023, @ 3:00 PM Eastern Standard Time
* **Amendment Number:** 5
* **Solicitation Number:** BPM019831/24197

**Additional Information**

Suppliers interested in participating in the ITQ must download the attached documents for more information. The following documents are available for download:

https://sscp2pspc.ssc-spc.gc.ca/page.aspx/en/fil/download_public/AE911617-21B8-4304-921A-D67DC5CCBEE8
https://sscp2pspc.ssc-spc.gc.ca/page.aspx/en/fil/download_public/56AB8BFE-834A-43C9-878
